
An agent encrypted a secret using RSA, but the public modulus is the product of two Blum primes. Crack the message: 3050083192873794723363435680070183398468801589974531894532769391851590977034876488396698353551731444347217796096875072354150893011972214215655087677518776


The flag format is flag{...}
n=6094230016858272745881718358533174159872320180244829972394263771129408691867749094758574917495166821967985942831984936714627157883105038299120068461087181, e=2582945271075682290215634866885478779935548958344640306355776347181487689487351197739603896348767075744552737890497551030379380024118030239170628377012621
The lower 104 bits of p are: 18066335067098450089994013121598723391

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{o7umhie0}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 3050083192873794723363435680070183398468801589974531894532769391851590977034876488396698353551731444347217796096875072354150893011972214215655087677518776
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=6094230016858272745881718358533174159872320180244829972394263771129408691867749094758574917495166821967985942831984936714627157883105038299120068461087181, e=2582945271075682290215634866885478779935548958344640306355776347181487689487351197739603896348767075744552737890497551030379380024118030239170628377012621
The lower 104 bits of p are: 18066335067098450089994013121598723391

extra_info: p=81518024784148294019383597903500727350815343418346899932366436994571139028287, q=74759294438195650449988906956511085872008282154321511674801671152126425637363, Ï†(n)=6094230016858272745881718358533174159872320180244829972394263771129408691867592817439352573550697449463125931018762113089054489471497870190973370896421532
